result.execSummary:
The defendant Jacob Robert Angus was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Failure to Support Child (<120 Days), a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 948.22(3).
  • Failure to Support Child (<120 Days), a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 948.22(3).
  • Failure to Support Child (<120 Days), a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 948.22(3).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: Routed to JA for further review. (5/17/17/hb)

with attachments and proposed order for payment of court appointed defense counsel fees from Atty. Rhiel in the amount of $336.00.

for Payment of Invoice filed by Attorney Rhiel
with attachments for payment of court appointed defense counsel fees from Attorney Rhiel  in the amount of $343 .
Jefferson County DNA Proof of Submission
Criminal Case Settlement

[JK] case called at 9:10am
Defendant Jacob Robert Angus in court with Attorney John Rhiel.  DA Susan Happ appears for the State of Wisconsin.
Maximum penalties recited; Constitutional rights reviewed; pleas of " Guilty " entered on count 1, count 2, and count 3; factual basis stipulated; victim rights compliance verified; the Court accepts the plea, finds the Defendant guilty, and orders Judgment of Conviction entered.
Sentencing arguments are given by counsel.

On Counts 1, 2, and 3, the Court withholds sentence, and places Defendant on Probation for 2 years, with conditions:

--AODA assement and follow-through with recommended treatment per Agent
--to undergo assessment, treatment, or counseling as deemed appropriate by the Agent
--maintain employment and/or education program as approved by the Agent
--comply with ALL family court orders concerning Child Support
--make all child support payments ON TIME
--make all payments on arrearages on time and according to the Child Support orders
--within the next 5 days of sentencing, Defendant shall report to the child support agency Jefferson County Courthouse, 311 South Center Avenue, Jefferson, Room 219 to complete  for a case management meeting 
--advise Child Support Office of any change of employment change within 48 hours of such change
--All Payments toward child support and arrearages to be paid through: WISCONSIN SUPPORT COLLECTION TRUST FUND, Box 74200 Milwaukee, WI 53274-0200 NOT through DOC
--to pay statutory costs, including DNA surcharge
--pay court costs, fees, assessments, and other surcharges
--pay attorney fees

Days credit for time already served:  1 day---Attorney Rhiel will double check the time served. If there is a change, the Court directs him to file a stipulation (no time limit given).
recess: 9:29am
Plea/sentencing hearing on February 23, 2017 at 09:00 am.
Status conference on April 18, 2017 at 10:00 am.
Pre-trial conference on February 15, 2017 at 02:00 pm.

Reserve Judge Neal Nettesheim presiding for Branch IV:
[MK] case called at 9:19am. 
Defendant Jacob Robert Angus in court with Attorney John Rhiel.  DA Susan Happ appears for the State of Wisconsin.  
Mr.  Angus waives his right to Preliminary Hearing; the Court accepts this waiver and binds him over for further proceedings.

--service of Information admitted, reading waived
--pleas of "not guilty" entered
The Court indicates that Bail remains as fixed.  
recess 9:23am.

[MK] case called at 11:15am. 
Defendant Jacob Robert Angus in court with Attorney John  Rhiel.  ADA Theresa Beck appears for the State of Wisconsin.
Mr. Angus indicates that his current address is:  274 Johnston Drive, Dousman WI.
Attorney Rhiel notes that he was just appointed as counsel; he requests the scheduling of another status.  
Instead the Court schedules the case for Preliminary Hearing.  
The Court indicates that Bail remains as fixed.  
recess 11:16am.
